revised_title: Energy Transfer in Solids and Gas Phase: A Comparative Study
tldr: This article explores the theory of non-radiative transfer of electronic excitation in both solid and gas phases. The authors present new results obtained from their reformulation of the Dexter-Forster theory and discuss the energy transfer cross-sections and quenching constants in both phases. They also compare the energy transfer in solids and gases, highlighting the differences in their mechanisms.
